alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 9:28PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A cold arctic airmass is now covering northeastern Colorado. Decent wind speeds will cause dangerous wind chill readings. Light to moderate snow is fall and will continue overnight. The greatest snowfall will be in the higher mountains. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and the Park Range and northern Gore Range. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
